docs.lead_paragraph: Going to church is good for your health. The exact reasons are unclear, but there are several likely explanations.

headline.seo: Why Going to Church Is Good for You

docs.abstract: Op-Ed column by T M Luhrmann contends one of most striking scientific discoveries about religion in recent years is that going to church weekly is good for one's physical and mental well-being; offers several likely explanations for phenomenon.
docs.snippet: Going to church is good for your health. The exact reasons are unclear, but there are several likely explanations.

headline.main: Hospital Dangers for Patients With Parkinson's

docs.abstract: Scheduling and medication errors plague patients with Parkinson’s in the hospital, experts say.
docs.snippet: Scheduling and medication errors plague patients with Parkinson’s in the hospital, experts say.

docs.lead_paragraph: A panel of experts said tamoxifen and raloxifene may be worth taking to lower the risk of breast cancer despite the potential for serious side effects like blood clots and strokes.

headline.seo: Breast Cancer Drugs Urged for Healthy High-Risk Women
headline.main: Breast Cancer Drugs Urged for Healthy High-Risk Women
headline.print_headline: Panel’s Report Urges Breast Cancer Drugs for Healthy Higher-Risk Women

docs.abstract: Influential panel of experts says breast cancer drugs tamoxifen and raloxifene may be worth taking for healthy higher-risk women, despite potential for serious side effects like blood clots and strokes.
docs.snippet: A panel of experts said tamoxifen and raloxifene may be worth taking to lower the risk of breast cancer despite the potential for serious side effects like blood clots and strokes.

keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph:
Laura Ward, 41, had always attributed her excess pounds to the drugs she takes for major depression. So Ms. Ward, who is 5-foot-6 and once weighed 220 pounds, didn’t try to slim down or avoid dietary pitfalls like fried chicken.
 
But in a clinical trial, Ms. Ward managed to lose more than 30 pounds doing low-impact aerobics three times a week . During the 18-month experiment, she was introduced to cauliflower and post-workout soreness for the first time. She and the other participants attended counseling sessions where they practiced refusing junk food and choosing smaller portions. She drank two liters of Diet Dr Pepper daily instead of eight.

headline.main: A Battle Plan to Lose Weight

docs.snippet:

headline.main: A Battle Plan to Lose Weight
headline.print_headline: A Battle Plan to Lose Weight

docs.abstract: People with mental illness are more likely to be overweight, with medications often contributing to the problem, and a study suggests structured programs may help them shed pounds.
docs.snippet: People with mental illness are more likely to be overweight, with medications often contributing to the problem, and a study suggests structured programs may help them shed pounds.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than a decade ago, tele-ICU command centers were trumpeted as the new standard in critical care, but the growth of such systems has stalled.

headline.seo: Promise of Centers for Remote Monitoring of ICU Patients Is Called Into Question
headline.main: The Doctor Is In, but Hundreds of Miles Away
headline.print_headline: Debating the Effectiveness of Remotely Monitoring Intensive Care Patients

docs.abstract: Independent studies question the effectiveness and cost-efficiency of tele-ICU command centers, once touted as new standard in critical care; growth in the systems, which allow doctors to monitor intensive care patients remotely, has stalled in recent years; many hospitals in the New York area and nationwide that adopted the technology have since discontinued its use.
docs.snippet: More than a decade ago, tele-ICU command centers were trumpeted as the new standard in critical care, but the growth of such systems has stalled.
